meanings.definition: The practice of insurers transferring portions of their risk portfolios to other parties to reduce the likelihood of having to pay a large obligation resulting from an insurance claim.
meanings.sent1: The company used reinsurance to share the risk of large claims with other insurers.
meanings.sent2: Reinsurance helps insurance companies manage their financial exposure to unexpected losses.
meanings.sent3: The reinsurance agreement turned out to be a lifesaver when a major disaster struck.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insurance, reinsurance acts as a safety net for unexpected events.
meanings.sent5: Understanding reinsurance is crucial for the stability of the insurance industry.

meanings.definition: The act of insuring again by transferring part of an insurance liability to another insurer.
meanings.sent1: After a large claim, the insurer decided to seek reinsurance to protect their financial position.
meanings.sent2: Reinsurance allows insurers to spread their risk and avoid potential financial strain.
meanings.sent3: The reinsurance process felt like a security blanket for the insurance company.
meanings.sent4: By engaging in reinsurance, insurers can better handle unexpected financial burdens.
meanings.sent5: The concept of reinsurance adds an extra layer of protection to the insurance industry.
